alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:00PM EDT until July 14 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SUSSEX...WARREN...SOUTHEASTERN MONROE AND NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 659 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Echo Lake to East Bangor, moving east at 20 mph. This storm has a history of producing wind damage in East Stroudsburg. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, East Stroudsburg, Hackettstown, Blairstown, Bangor, Franklin, Pen Argyl, Hamburg, Belvidere, Oxford, Hope, East Bangor, Branchville, Andover, Werry Lake, Greendell, Millbrook, Delaware Water Gap, Crandon Lakes and Great Meadows-Vienna. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 313 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 23. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
